characters: WE HEAR THE HORRIFYING SOUNDS OF CRUNCHING METAL. CRUNCHI
WE STAY AT THE FOOT OF THE STAIRS -
A VISION OF RENEE'S GRAVE APPEARS -
THE POTATO TRUCK COLLIDES WITH AMANDA'S CAR. HEAD ON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A storm is raging outside. We hear the clap and roll of T

dialogues.speaker: TOMB STAIRWAY -
dialogues.text: RATS scurry away down the scum-covered steps as the GLOW LANTERN and FOOTSTEPS herald someone's arrival...

dialogues.speaker: GENVIEVE LEMARCHE
dialogues.text: emerges around the bend. Mid-30s. Cultured beauty. Her dr face are smeared with grime and... is that blood we see t only knows what's happened to her. Genvieve ducks under a monstrous cobweb as she passes an window.

dialogues.speaker: WINDOW
dialogues.text: LIGHTNING streaks across the night sky outside. We catch of the MOON disappearing behind the clouds. Genvieve reaches the bottom of the stairs. The tomb itsel Water trickles in through cracks in the lichen-covered wa pooling on the tomb floor. Genvieve moves forward, her lantern throwing distorted sh over everything... In front of her is Anton LeMarche's stone sarcophagus. Genvieve kneels in the water, one hand resting on the spi railing which surrounds the tomb. She reaches the other h towards a scum-covered plaque, brushing the grime away... THUNDER and LIGHTNING reach a crescendo as... A SKELETAL HAND rises out of the water, reaching for her. Genvieve SCREAMS. The lantern falls from her grasp, sputt out. The hand reaches for her arm and inadvertently clutc breast instead... Genvieve starts to laugh hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut! Thank you, Renee. Can we throw some light on the set?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry... Suddenly it is lighter. Genvieve can't stop laughing. The monster hand disappears back beneath the water.

dialogues.speaker: WE PULL BACK, REVEALING -
dialogues.text: It's not 1865. The LeMarche Castle tomb is in fact, a 90s set. We are inside a soundstage, on a raised set, so the should really read...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FILM CREW scurries about. Everyone is LAUGHING now. The sits to the right. He and the DP are already huddled over video-assist monitor. We see the previous scene rewinding speed. The FIRST A.D. moves in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water in the pool's running low, fill her up! Crewmembers move towards the set. An SFX PUPPETEER (i.e., the skeletal arm) crawls out from followed by an ELECTRICIAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see shit down there! I'm working blind!

dialogues.speaker: GENVIEVE/THE ACTRESS
dialogues.text: rises out of the water. Her name is actually RENEE HALLOW beauty is undeniable, even in such a disheveled state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is great, I could've spent four months on a romantic comedy with Warren Beatty, and instead, I've got a horny zombie trying to cop a feel! The crew members LAUGH. She's well-liked on the set. Rene Wardrobe and make-up personnel move in to adjust Renee's  appearance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhgh, there's water everywhere... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get a cigarette? The MAKE-UP GIRL pulls a pack of cigarettes from her fann and offers Renee one. In a flash, a P.A. appears with a l Renee mumbles "thanks" as she fires up. She squints her e trying to see past the set lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody see my boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here, Mom... GEOFF MATTHEWS, Renee's 12 year-old son steps into view. face lights up when she sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couple minutes. I saw the last shot. That was pretty cool. Renee grimaces as the make-up girl spritzes her face with bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (casually)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did it go with your father last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. He said he'd be over for dinner at eight... (awkward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean... he misses you, Mom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss him too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't want you to get your hopes up, okay? We're trying to work things out, but... Her voice trails off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (affectionate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know everything, don't you? Renee and Geoff are interrupted by a CREWMEMBER who's spr "atmosphere" about the set with a hand-held smoke machine coughs. Off-set, the FIRST A.D. is trying to get the show on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, people! Quiet! We're going to try this another time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess it's showtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Renee kisses Geoff on the forehead. He takes the cigarett her and moves off the set, standing near the camera. The director turns back toward Renee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Renee. Last time. I promise. We nail this and you won't have to do this ever again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you said the first time... Renee turns and heads back toward the stairs. A P.A. hand new lantern. As she reaches the stairs, the house lights creating the proper atmosphere once again.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE SET -
dialogues.text: The puppeteer gets ready. It's cramped. The electrician c power box connection. The director nods to the camera operator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling. Speed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Castle of Terror." Scene 69A. Take thirteen. The slate comes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Action! The scene replays itself as before, only now we're watchi action from multiple viewpoints. We start on the video assist monitor, then move up to...

dialogues.speaker: GEOFF
dialogues.text: He grins as he watches the scene unfold.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SET
dialogues.text: Renee has reached the sarcophagus. LIGHTNING flashes. The hand bursts up, grabbing Renee's arm. The scene continues original point of interruption.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE SET -
dialogues.text: We see an undetected LEAK. Water drips down. The puppetee position, struggling, and... ...knocks over the power box which SPARKS just as...

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE -
dialogues.text: Renee/Genvieve grabs the iron railing with both hands. Electricity surges through Renee. Her body jerks and writ some nightmarish marionette.

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE SET -
dialogues.text: The electrician drags the puppeteer back. Sparks fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! We've crossed over into 220! Shut down the generator!

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE -
dialogues.text: Crewmembers SCREAM and scramble back... All the circuits are blowing, lights EXPLODING and shower sparks over the whole set. This is not part of the movie.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: It's awful. She shakes, her SMOKING HANDS frozen to the i railing by the electricity running through her... Suddenly, Renee falls forward against the iron. Her face SMOKE AND SINGE... The lights CONTINUE TO BLOW, casting a strobic effect ove soundstage, adding to the chaos.

dialogues.speaker: ON GEOFF
dialogues.text: As he witnesses the whole event. He tries to rush forward someone restrains him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!!!! Suddenly all the circuits in the stage are blown and the OUT. Renee slumps back into the water, smoke trailing up still form. And we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An aged GOLDEN RETRIEVER is on the surgical table. CHASE D.V.M., gently strokes the dog's fur. He's good with the kind. The retriever's owners: a MOTHER and her SON, look

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think this is probably for the best. He's a very old dog. He has arthritis. He has cataracts in his eyes... Chase looks at the mother. He's always hated this part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's had a good life... (to dog)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...haven't you, boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Matthews, your son is on line one. He says it's an emergency... Chase breaks concentration, pulling his eyes away from th and son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blur of activity converges on the movie set. A TRIO OF  PARAMEDICS. A FIRE OFFICIAL. A POLICE OFFICER. Medical eq Horrified crewmembers watch on, helpless. WE STAY ON Geoff, momentarily blocked out and then reveal and again, amidst the commotion of paramedics scrambling Renee. The director has his hand on Geoff's shoulder. Geoff's eyes dart about, taking it all in. Things are hap very fast: --Renee's hand is lifted. Someone checking her pulse. --H eyelids parted. A pen light flashing at her fixed pupils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run me down a line of normal saline. --An I.V. needle plunges into the inside of Renee's elbow syringe injects into the I.V. post. --Hands hook up a life-pack monitor. Renee's dress is tor Electrodes press to bare skin. --The monitor screen blink life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a bradycardic rhythm at 30. --Another PARAMEDIC dials out on a cellular phone, to the consulting physician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White female. Approximately thirty five years old. Electrocution... --A clear tube is inserted down her throat. --The monitor erratic heartbeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in V-fib. --There's a renewed urgency even amidst their rush. --Defibrillator paddles are pressed to her chest. Geoff looks to the monitor as... --It goes to flatline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Geoff moves forward, pulling away from the director. The officer moves in and intercepts Geoff, turning the boy aw Geoff's eyes fix on the monitor. An unbending flatline...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to bring her back... Chase rushes onto the set, pushing past crewmembers. He f the sight of the horrific commotion around Renee's still

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus... Chase's gaze connects with his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (helpless)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad... We pull back from Geoff, Chase, and the commotion around Farther and farther as the darkness around the set begins in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're losing her... Darkness everywhere and we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A form drifts forward, materializing out of the fog. It's a CASKET. Appearing as if it's floating among the cl PULLING BACK, WE SEE that it's moving along A CONVEYOR. A WE CAN make out the faint form of A PLANE as the conveyor from the cargo compartment. The casket reaches the end of the conveyor. A tag marks i destination: Bangor, Maine. HANDS reach in and lift the c FOUR BAGGAGE HANDLERS hoist the casket up onto their shou carry it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true she grew up around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Over in Ludlow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Never met a movie star before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you're a little late for an autograph. The baggage handlers laugh as they walk off into the dist fog closes around them and we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We drift down from the gray sky to the somber scene below the distance, a crowd of MOURNERS are gathered around a g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I am the resurrection and the life, saith the Lord...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE HEADSTONE is adorned with an iron plaque. It reads, s RENEE HALLOW MATTHEWS 1955-1991

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...She that believeth in me, though she were dead, yet shall she live; and whosoever liveth and believeth in me, shall never die... THE CASKET is slowly lowered into the open grave. As it d WE SEE Geoff and his father, Chase, standing at the foref the crowd. Renee's grave is next to those of her parents. Among the mourners is MARJORIE HARGROVE, an attractive lo in her early twenties. Further down the hillside, a wall of NEWS REPORTERS are g behind a roped-off media boundary. There is a blinding fl PHOTO FLASHES as the press records the scene before them. A SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT PATROL CAR cruises up the cemetery pulling to a stop near the mob of reporters. Out of the car steps GUS GILBERT. Gus is nearly forty, wi Sheriff's uniform fitted to his solid, ageless frame. Gru a little self-important: Gus likes being a big fish in a pond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drawing near)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's keep it back, folks. Try to show her a little respect... A REPORTER ducks under the media boundary, moving in for shot. He doesn't make it two steps before he's intercepted by G grabs the reporter and shoves him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! What did I just say? Gus means business. One look into his eyes reveals his in nonsense approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ass-hole... The reporter backs off.

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE GRAVESIDE -
dialogues.text: Beneath the gloomy, ominous skies, the lines on Chase's f him as a decade older than his thirty-five years. Chase g places a comforting hand on Geoff's shoulder. Geoff inches forward, pulling free of Chase's touch. Draw mother, drawn from his father. The only blemishes on his rosy cheeks are the tears, the endless tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that my redeemer liveth, and that he shall stand at the latter day upon the earth. Geoff looks upon the casket, gazing into the abyss of des

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOWING THE CEREMONY
dialogues.text: The crowd has dispersed. Geoff is standing at the base of Renee's grave. His eyes Unmoving. Unaccepting. Chase is nearby, watching, not wanting to intrude on Geof private moment. Gus quietly moves in at Chase's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she always have reporters following her around like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty much so. Gus glances at Geoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you moved into town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to get Geoff out of L.A. Just start things over, you know? Gus nods. Now his eyes fall on Renee's headstone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember when Renee left. She couldn't wait to get out of Ludlow. She used to say that life moved too slow here... Chase forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Renee alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose so. The sky above seems heavy with imminent rain and we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lazy oaks embrace a vintage, two-story Victorian home in neighborhood of Ludlow, Maine. A commercial MOVING VAN is out front. Marjorie, the girl we saw at Renee's funeral, is coming d sidewalk. She checks the address on the front of the hous heads up the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving boxes clutter the downstairs. Chase is weaving through the maze, doing an inventory on boxes. A sweaty PAIR OF MOVERS are climbing up the stairs. Each hunched  over, with a garment box balanced on his back. T of each carton is boldly labeled: RENEE - ATTIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got six more of these. You sure you want them all in the attic? Chase is contemplating a compromise when Geoff appears fr kitchen doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Geoff, what if we just give the clothes to Goodwill? We'll keep the rest. Just the clothes. Geoff shakes his head, firm and deliberate denial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one who wanted to move. Nobody would've touched them if you didn't want to move here... Chase weakens, giving in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the 'Renee' boxes go in the attic. Sorry. Marjorie KNOCKS on the open frame of the front door. Geoff recognizes her from his mother's funeral. She flash warm smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm Marjorie Hargrove. Your new housekeeper. Marjorie has a naive, friendly quality about her. She's a blessed with eye-popping genetics. Standing there outside door, looking more than a little nervous... we can't help her. Needless to say, she doesn't look like your typical  housekeeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: Chase's reaction)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... no. You just... look different than you sounded on the phone. Please, come in. Marjorie enters. She grins at Geoff again. Yep. She's ner alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm real excited about working for you Mr. Matthews...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well we're glad to have you, Marjorie. You can call me Chase, by the way. Marjorie passes her curious eyes over one of Renee's garm containers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always admired Ms. Hallow. That scene she did in Blue Midnight, where her lover meets her at the train station... (she sighs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must've watched that movie four times. Chase smiles. Marjorie's enthusiasm is endearing. Just then, one of the movers loses his grip. A garment bo down the slope of the stairs. When it reaches the bottom, spill over the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I'll get that... Marjorie moves for the spill. The first dress she touches beaded peach evening gown. Her fingers linger on the fabr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is gorgeous. She wore this at the Emmys, didn't she? Geoff moves forward, acting overly defensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't touch her stuff. It made her crazy when people touched her stuff. Marjorie is taken aback by the oddity of Geoff's statemen Chase catches her eye, shrugging apologetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VAN is parked outside. The rear side panel is masked of tape and a stencil. Chase grabs the corner of the tape an carefully peels it back, revealing a crisp, new business

dialogues.speaker: CHASE MATTHEWS, D.V.M.
dialogues.text: Serving Aroostook County

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ESTABLISHING. Shops and businesses situated around a lazy square. QUiet. Relaxed. As rural as they come. WE pick up Chase's van as it cruises by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase pulls the van in front of an unassuming veterinary On the door is Chase's nameplate. And on the weathered wa outline of letters where the name and title "Quentin Yola Doctor of Veterinary Medicine" once was. Geoff is first out of the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff and Chase move inside. The offices look like they w in the 40s. A dark corridor stretches down the center of suite. Faded green walls are solid, with few exteriors. I creepy in here. Heavy, grey plastic curtains absorb much of the light whi find its way in. Nothing looks like it's been updated in fifty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This doesn't look so bad... Chase sweeps a curtain aside, revealing the interior to G Dust swirls in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long ago did this guy retire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a few years. Geoff takes a look around, growing uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptical)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few? Geoff moves on down the central corridor which seems to g darker and more dismal with every step. He moves on into boarding room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rows of kennels are stacked along the walls, smothered wi cobwebs. Ancient, rusted surgical equipment is scattered  everywhere. The place is a mess. Windows are boarded up a shadows cloak the room. Over to the right, Geoff hears a RUSTLING. A CARDBOARD BOX on one of the shelves jiggles. Something around inside it. Geoff's eyes widen. Still, morbid curiosity propels him f The box rustles again. He reaches for it and... A CREATURE LEAPS out at him, HOWLING. Geoff SCREAMS and j back. The box tumbles over and... A CAT crawls out. Behind the protective mother, are four cutest kittens we've ever seen, MEWING away. Geoff sighs just as Chase rushes into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. I just got spooked by a bunch of furballs. Inside the box is a note. Chase reaches for it. It reads: warm welcome to you."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, now I've opened an orphanage too. One of the kittens pads out of the box and looks up at Ge sleepy eyes. Her fur is striped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll take one. If it's okay... Geoff lifts the fragile creature, cradling it in his arms

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks like a tiger. Chase spies an old broom resting in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what, you do some sweeping up here, and she's yours. Geoff nods and Chase moves back out into the hallway. Geoff sets the box back upright and lowers Tiger in with kittens. He reaches for the broom and goes to work sweepi the cobwebs. Just as soon as he turns his back, Tiger climbs the side box, spilling over onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase is unpacking a shipment of medical supplies. When h them in the cabinet, he stirs up a layer of dust. Tiger scampers by as Chase coughs his way out of the clou dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiger sees the front door ajar. And as she approaches to what lies beyond-- The door swings open... ZOWIE, A SIBERIAN HUSKY is staring back at her. He's blac white with blue eyes, with a mask that is at once menacin majestic. A pudgy thirteen year old boy, DREW, has a hold of the do collar. Zowie's BARK sends Tiger scrambling. Drew loses his grip as Zowie yanks free. A strong, patern command calls after Drew from outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew, you get a handle on that dog, now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase spins around at the commotion as Tiger darts across floor with the barking dog in pursuit. Mayhem ensues as Zowie's big paws slip on the slick tile. Geoff rushes in from the boarding area. Tiger ducks beneath the back of a surgical gurney. Zowie's snoot wedges beneath the base, inches from Tiger' striking paw. Drew slides in on his knees, renewing his hold on Zowie's He pulls the dog back. Geoff rescues Tiger from beneath the gurney. Drew shrugs sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. He gets kinda hyper... Drew's stepfather, Gus Gilbert, enters. The dreaded, domi voice of authority in Drew's life. WE know him as the she Renee's funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, he thought it was lunch. How ya doin', Chase? (a handshake)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't met my boy. (aside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew, where the hell are your manners. Drew steps forward and awkwardly offers his hand to Chase Geoff. The boys shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a cool lookin' dog. Zowie lurches forward, eager to shower affection on Geoff strokes the dog's soft mane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zowie. Drew puts his palm under Zowie's chin and turns him for C see. There are several scabbed-over gashes on his left ch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn dog stuck his nose in on my rabbits and they ganged up on him. I swear that dog's an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he gonna be okay? With one eye on Zowie, Chase sprays some antiseptic on th examination table and wipes it clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's have him hop up here. Drew prods Zowie. Zowie jumps up onto the table. Chase lo the facial lacerations, then turns on a penlight and exam dog's eyes. Gus passes a lingering look over Tiger. He reaches in to making sure it meets with Geoff's approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was young I thought cats were the girls and dogs were the boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are three more girls where that one came from looking for homes. Drew perks up at the thought, but Gus shoots it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not our home. Chase takes the light out of Zowie's eyes. He looks to Gu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thee facial lacerations should heal up pretty quickly. I'll give you som antibiotic cream--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Drew, he's your dog. Are you listening to this? Chase turns to Drew and continues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His left eye is scratched, corneal abrasion. Eyedrops will help, but it's going to take som time. Try to keep him away from those rabbits, huh? Drew nods, casting a glance aside at Gus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chase)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear you've got Marjorie Hargrove working for you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know that? Gus gives Chase a knowing grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a small town, Chase. Gus laughs and claps Chase on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Geoff, did you know your mother and I used to be high- school sweethearts? Geoff is surprised at this. Surprised and annoyed. Tact i quality that Gus possesses in abundance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homecoming. Prom. Whole nine yards. (to Chase)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Course that was a lifetime ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUNIOR HIGH SCHOOL KIDS are converging en masse for class Chase's van pulls up front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase digs some cash out of his wallet. Geoff stares out school. He's dreading this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's a lunch cost these days? You want ten?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unenthused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Chase looks at his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You nervous? New town, new school. I know it must be pretty hard for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be fine, Dad. Geoff reaches for the door, but Chase stops him. He's try reach his son. He really is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awkward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff... you have to help me out here a little... "MEOW!" Chase drops his eyes to the bulge squirming aroun Geoff's jacket. He can't help but smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you don't want me to pick you up. It's a long ride. Geoff opens the side panel of the van and slips out his M BIKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what my bike's for... Before Chase can say another word, Geoff is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Chase pulls away, WE SEE the handmade sign taped in th window:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew is among a small circle of BOYS. He recognizes Geoff his bike from the van. The largest of the boys, CLYDE, ta notice of the unfamiliar face. Clyde is fifteen, going on twenty. You know the type: loc held back a year or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check it out. That's the new kid. The son of that movie star. Mischief gleams in Clyde's eyes as he watches Geoff's eve The other boys follow suit. Clyde always takes the lead. Geoff fields their penetrating stares. For a second his e connect with Clyde's, then he moves on into the building. Among the boys, Drew is the reluctant participant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. GORDON is addressing a room of SEVENTH GRADERS. Geoff is doodling in his notebook, feeling acutely out of he tries to avoid the curious glances the rest of his new classmates are giving him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People, this is Geoff Matthews. He'll be joining our class for the rest of the school year... As Mrs. Gordon points to him, Geoff drops his face even l This is the worst embarrassment a boy could ever suffer. to throttle Mrs. Gordon. A freckle-faced boy, DOUG, fires off a question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what's Hollywood like? Do you know Eddie Murphy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (annoyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we save that for later, Doug? A girl with braces, SUSAN, continues the interrogation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Julia Roberts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan! That'll be enough. Susan shuts up. Geoff sinks even lower in his seat. The kids turn their eyes back to the front of the room. But one classmate's eyes are still on Geoff. It's Clyde. Clyde shifts his stare to the squirming lump in Geoff's j catches a glimpse of Tiger's bobbing nose popping out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff joins the stampede of kids as the BELL releases the day. Almost immediately, Clyde and his cronies, STEVIE AN fall in step behind him. Drew hangs slightly off to the s really wanting to be a part of the intimidation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the hurry, Junior? Where you off to? Clyde quickens his pace, pulling ahead of Geoff and stopp front of him. Stevie and Brad move in on either side. Sur by peers, it's apparent how small Geoff is for his age. On the wall next to them is a bulletin board display. Cly glances at it. Geoff follows his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: DISPLAY
dialogues.text: It's one of those corny school affairs with construction letters spelling out: "WE REMEMBER RENEE HALLOW." Beneath pictures of Renee clipped from various magazines. Cloying tasteless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feigning remorse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad about your Mom. Papers said it was pretty gross, getting fried like that. Guess you saw it, huh? Geoff nods. Clyde raises his eyebrows, pulling Geoff's ja open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what are you hiding there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you bring a friend to school you're supposed to introduce him. Geoff's arm tightens protectively around Tiger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her name's Tiger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiger? Don't you think that's kind of a pussy name? (reaching out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I hold her? I promise I'll be real careful. Clyde has a convincing way about him. Geoff reluctantly h kitten over. Clyde is so gentle with the creature that on never question his sincerity. Geoff is just beginning to feel at ease when something ch Clyde's tone, something sinister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Geoff. You ever seen a kitten run?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen her run around the house. Clyde's eyes narrow. He takes a couple of steps back. Geo heart starts to sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I mean really run... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like this! Clyde backsteps and bolts off down the hallway with Tiger and Stevie fall in behind him, laughing. Drew shrugs apologetically. He's torn, but he tears off a nonetheless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit... Geoff runs off in pursuit of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff rushes from the building, searching the dispersing There they are, tearing from the bike racks, pedaling for street. Clyde sees Geoff and mockingly holds the kitten out for d they ride by. Geoff runs for the bike racks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde and his cohorts break from the outskirts of town, r onto the open road. Clyde glances back toward the center of town. Geoff is so far behind he's barely visible. Clyde returns his eyes to the road ahead, raising Tiger n nose with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having fun yet? Clyde and his smirking buddies ride on, OUT OF FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: WITH GEOFF
dialogues.text: giving the pedals all he can, struggling to keep pace wit boys.

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER ALONG
dialogues.text: Scattered houses sprinkle the landscape ahead. Cochran La stretches into the distance beyond the housing. Clyde's clan cuts from the road and blazes a trail across residential property. The two-story house is weathered an up. It looks vaguely familiar. Creepy. And when WE FIND the mailbox post, we know why. The name but there's no question who once lived there. Five bold l

dialogues.speaker: "CREED."
dialogues.text: Geoff whips by in a blur, still in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde and his friends have abandoned their bikes. They've position on top of the slope of the hill, standing at the THE PATH TO THE PET SEMATARY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff pulls his bike to a stop short of the boys. He dism leans it up against a tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me the cat, all right? A devilish grin creeps over Clyde. He strolls down the pa Geoff. Clyde grabs Geoff's handlebars and, backing up, pu and the bike with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would but... there was a little accident... (feeding off Geoff's alarm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was trying to get away. You know, running down my leg... and her head got too close to the  spokes. Pretty gross. What's left of her is up in the Pet Sematary. A zip-lock bag might help... (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but I happen to be out of them at the moment. Drew shakes his head, disgusted he has to put up with Cly antics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Clyde, just tell him where the cat is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning on Drew)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I TOLD HIM where the cat is! Now shut up, fuck-face! Clyde punches Drew in the arm. Drew shrinks back. Geoff flashes a hateful stare at Clyde. All of the boys but Clyde are uncomfortably silent. There something frightening about Clyde... something that exten the standard bully antics. We begin to get the feeling th kid is genuinely deranged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relishing the moment)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard about the Creed murders yet? And the place where the dead come back to life? He motions to the path behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just back there. Just down that path...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meekly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde... it's not funny anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh? So you got a problem? What're you gonna do, fat-ass? You gonna sic big, bad, old Gus after me? Drew shuts up. Clyde turns back to Geoff, drawing closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think, Geoff? Maybe you could dig up your Mom and take her back there. Maybe if you pray real hard, she'll come back. With this last remark Clyde has pushed too far. Geoff's f red with anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me the cat, ass-hole. Clyde's grin falters a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, maybe I'm a little hard of hearing... but did you just call me an ass-hole? Clyde pokes Geoff in the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mad, Geoff? Cause if you are, you should take a shot at me... This time Clyde shoves Geoff back even harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you pussy! What's the matter with you? Clyde moves forward again and Geoff suddenly LASHES OUT, everyone off guard. For an instant, Drew marvels at Geoff's tenacity. Clyde LUNGES. He hammers Geoff with blows. Outsizing him by forty pounds, Clyde tosses Geoff to the Geoff struggles, but Clyde's grip proves arresting. Clyde throws Geoff onto his stomach, forcing his face int dirt. It looks as if he's ready to smother his opponent. Drew is the first to rush in. Brad and Stevie quickly fol takes all three of them to peel Clyde off Geoff. Clyde gets to his feet and backs away. There's great plea his crazed eyes as he watches Geoff coughing and gasping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin' ass-hole. Satisfied he's handed out enough ill will for the day, Cl away. Drew's attentions remain on Geoff. As Clyde strolls by, h Drew's arm and swings him around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way, fat-boy. Stevie and Brad follow. As the group passes Geoff's bike, gives it a kick, knocking it over. Then they're gone. Geoff pulls himself to his feet. Brushing off the mess, h up the path in search of Tiger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woods here have grown long with shadows. The air is s the sound of birds is conspicuously absent. A WOODEN ARCHWAY frames the entrance to the primitive gra Scrawled across the weatherstained boards is a child's ba legible attempt at "PET SEMATARY." Geoff trepidatiously enters the clearing of crude, crowde Collars, leashes, bird cages and other accessories adorn makeshift crosses and headstones. Geoff moves along the outer circle of markers, each craft child's caring hands. As he searches, he can't help but notice the heartfelt ep On the outer circle, he sees a crate-board marker memoria SMUCKY THE CAT... HE WAS OBEDIANT. MOVING INWARD, the markers are older. The ones he can sti convey a sense of the perpetual cycle of life and death. Here is a wide, flat, upright board planted deep in the e Memory of MARTA our Pet Rabit Dyed March 1 1965." The next three rows are illegible, the inscriptions are w beyond recognition... And then, chiseled into sandstone: THE BEST DOG THAT EVER LIVED 1929-1939. And now... "MEOW." Faint. But very much alive. Geoff picks up his pace, weaving quickly toward the cente There, he finds Tiger. Trapped in a rusted old birdcage, swallowed by the grave. Geoff opens the door and frees Tiger, stroking the trembl kitten. Geoff's eyes are drawn to the far perimeter... to the dea THE DEADFALL looms on the outskirts of the clearing like skeletal remains. An abstract stairway to things beyond. picks up just then, sending leaves skittering in waves ac ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Geoff turns around, he finds Drew waiting for him un archway. Drew smiles, full of respect for Geoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen anybody punch Clyde before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pissed me off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his smile fading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about your mom. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't handle not having my mom around. Just having Gus... He grimaces at the thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad's not so bad. Drew glances around at all the makeshift grave markers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear, sometimes I wish Gus was dead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't ever say that about your parents, not even your Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stepdad. Gus is my stepdad. Geoff nods knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was all that stuff about dead people coming back to life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. It's just an old ghost story. Let's get out of here... They head off, full of childhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marjorie is at the stove, fixing up dinner, while Chase s newspaper at the table. Geoff enters through the kitchen door. He moves past them a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! How was your first day at school?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over his shoulder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now is that any way to talk to your father? Geoff stops for a moment, turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not my mother. ...and exits through the opposite door. Chase looks to Marjorie and offers a sympathetic shrug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRUDE CAGES HOUSE DOZENS OF RABBITS. Situated alongside t garage. A sign above the cages reads: PET RABBITS - $10.0 positioned along the roof threaten to reveal foul play. Gus is rigging a wire along the base of the cage. Finishing it off, he hangs the plug next to an outside so Moving onto the next chore, he pours pressed alfalfa pell feeding slots for the hungry rabbits. Setting the feed aside, he takes a seat. Opening one of t he grabs a rabbit and sets it on his lap, gently petting fur. One of the cages starts to vibrate. Gus gives it a look: A PAIR OF RABBITS aren't interested eating, they're joined in fast and furious passion. Gus gets a chuckle out of the sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go, Romeo... Gus replaces the rabbit in the hutch. And before he goes, THE PLUG INTO THE SOCKET. An ELECTRICAL CHARGE dances alo base of the cage, a deterrent for intruders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew's mother, AMANDA, withdraws a roast from the oven. Gus is at the sink, washing his hands. He turns to see Zo laying at Drew's feet in the living room. Drew is watchin VIDEO on TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew, I don't remember inviting Zowie in for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just until he heals up? Gus is waggling his thumb toward the back door. Drew slumps in defeat. Gus reaches into the cabinet and pours himself a Bourbon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew walks Zowie from the house with a dish of dog food. pass the rabbit dens, Zowie alters his path. Drew gets a of his collar and pulls him back. Across the yard is an enclosed dog run. Twenty feet long feet wide. Drew puts Zowie inside with the dog food. Drew strokes Zowie's mane affectionately, then backs away the wood-framed door to the dog run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda's about to put the roast on the table when Gus nuz behind her, breathing down her backside. With his drink i he sweeps her hair aside and zeros in for a kiss on the b the neck. Gus eases his free hand around between Amanda and the cou presses his palm firmly into her crotch, drawing her body him. She stiffens at his intimate hold, uncomfortable with his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus, please... At the back door, Drew is watching from beyond the screen disgusted by the sight of Gus pawing his mother. Drew swi door open as loud as he can to signal his return. Gus plants a last kiss on the back of Amanda's neck and b But before he goes, he snatches a chunk of meat from the platter. Leveling his leering eyes at Amanda, he stuffs i his mouth suggestively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn, you're good. Drew rolls his eyes and takes his seat at the table, retu attention to the TV, where another MUSIC VIDEO is on. Gus glances at the TV, annoyed by the MUSIC. He drops int spot at the head of the table, blocking Drew's view. Drew the side for a better look. Gus takes notice and leans to side to obstruct his view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're breaking the law here, Drew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, Gus. It won't bother me. Gus ignores her, inching forward with a confidential, har whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom's spent the last hour cooking. Stop being a little jerk and show her some appreciation. Drew aims the remote control at Gus, as if to shut him up silences the TV. Amanda approaches with the roast. The moment it's on the Drew starts dishing up a hefty serving. Gus spears Drew's with the serving fork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that much appreciation. I thought we were gonna tone down that flabby ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm so sorry I'm not the stud that you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock it off, guys... Gus throws back a sip of Bourbon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Drew, quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You watch that mouth of yours, Drew buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING THROUGH Zowie's enclosed pen, WE SEE no sign of th REACHING the door, WE FIND that the wood around the botto has been chewed through. The base of the door is ajar, ju for a dog to have slipped through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the still of the night, Gus' rabbit pens sit unattende then WE HEAR the tinkling of dog tags. Snoozing rabbits a Zowie lumbers INTO FRAME. Zowie rises on his hind legs, pressing his paws to a cage sparks fly as Zowie is jolted with the electrical charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ELECTRICAL ZING. The dog's whimpering CRY. And the RI BELLS reach Gus in rapid succession, rousting him from hi He rolls out of bed and grabs his robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, Drew. That dog is history! Amanda stirs, groggily focusing on Gus' departing figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew swings open the door to the hallway as Gus marches b stuffing shells into a shotgun. Panicked, Drew takes off him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zowie swings his head in the direction of the house as Gu through the back door. Drew is one step behind. Gus swings the gun up and fires off a SHOT. Zowie bolts for the shadows of the hillside. Drew rushes in and deflects the aim of the rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot him! Gus' eyes are wild with anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, Drew? What did you say?! Gus throws Drew aside, brings the rifle back up and FIRES random shot after the fleeing dog. All the while, his eye on Drew, as if this were the boy's lesson to be learned. He squeezes off one more SHOT... A PAINED YELP echoes from the hillside. Zowie's yelp. Drew whips his head aside in sickened shock. Even Gus is by the unexpected hit. All they can hear now are Zowie's WHIMPERING CRIES dimini the night. Drew shoots Gus a look of such unbridled hatred that Gus speechless. He backs away from Gus and darts off toward t hillside. When Gus turns back for the house, Amanda is standing the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Gus, what have you done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, come on, Amanda, stop looking at me like that. He's had ample warning about that dog. Amanda glares at him, an outpouring of pent-up strain. Gus defiantly marches past Amanda, entering the house wit meeting eyes with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew pauses long enough to listen for Zowie... Nothing until a FAINT CRY drifts back at him.

dialogues.speaker: DEEPER IN THE WOODS
dialogues.text: Zowie limps INTO FRAME. Blood is flowing from the bullet his left hindquarter, trailing from his suspended leg. Ev is a strain.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: comes upon a break in the trees. The hanging moon outline knoll stretching beyond. And then, the strained breathing hushed WHIMPER. Drew hesitantly approaches the crest of the knoll. Zowie is just beyond, lying on his side at the end of the trail. His chest rises and falls almost imperceptibly wit effort to survive. Drew drops to his knees at Zowie's side and cradles the d lap, shaking his head in denial. Zowie's weak eyes shift, gazing longingly at Drew. Drew strokes the fur under Zowie's chin, hardly able to s dog through his glaze of tears. Zowie's eyes drift off. His chest falls and doesn't rise falls limp in Drew's arms. Drew hugs Zowie even tighter a begins to weep.

dialogues.speaker: FROM A DISTANCE
dialogues.text: WE SEE the image of Drew with the dog cradled in his arms silhouetted against the moonlit horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff appears from the garage with his bike and takes off road. A WHISTLE catches his ear. Drew is at the edge of the woods, beckoning for Geoff. Geoff circles around and doubles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just going by your house. Where's your bike? The closer Geoff gets, the more he sees of Drew's despair sees the dried blood staining Drew's clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zowie's dead. Geoff's heart sinks. An unspoken moment of sympathy passe the boys. Fighting the emotions, Drew finally speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to bury him. I don't want to go out there alone. There's such grief in Drew's words that Geoff can't resis glances toward his house to make sure he hasn't been seen blends into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew carries Zowie's relaxed form in his arms. Geoff is f balancing a pickaxe and shovel. Arriving at the graveyard, Geoff searches the outer perim a vacant stretch of soil. Finding one, he lets the heavy fall to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a good spot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not burying him here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a better place... Drew heads for the base of the deadfall, with Zowie in hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's back here somewhere, through the Indian woods. I know we can find it... Drew continues up the deadfall, disappearing over the cre Geoff gathers up the shovel and pickaxe and follows after

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, wait up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff climbs over the peak of the deadfall... Beyond is a dark swamp, A BOG, looking unlike anything on expect in Maine. Tendrils of ground fog swirl about veget that looks almost prehistoric. Gnarled trees rise up from murky earth, blocking the sun from view. Geoff hurries down the other side of the deadfall to catc Drew. Somewhere off in the distance we hear an UNEARTHLY Not a bird. Not any animal known to man. Spectral shapes flicker at the edge of Geoff's vision, si back into the shadows as Geoff tries to focus on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uneasy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew, where are we going? Drew doesn't respond. He continues on without another wor bent on finding this "better place."

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER ALONG
dialogues.text: At the boundary of the bog, A STAIRWAY OF HUGE, WIDE STON from the blanket of ground fog. Bordered by fir trees. Le the hillside. The final leg of Drew and Geoff's journey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it... I wasn't sure if it even really existed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old Indian burial ground. Geoff's eyes move to the stairway of stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, that's just a bullshit story. You said so yourself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it's not bullshit? If I bury Zowie there, and it works... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...he'll come back alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew, I know your dog died, but... get a grip, man, you're freaking me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if there was even one chance in a million it'd work, wouldn't you want to try? Geoff feels for Drew. It's pointless to reason. Drew starts up the stone steps. Geoff has no choice but t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even in broad daylight, the flat-topped mesa has a sense foreboding isolation. There's an almost palpable sense of "wrongness" about this place. As if the darkness of a dyi hole was seeping out of the ground and spreading across t Drew and Geoff approach the circle of rocky soil. They st the border, looking it over in eerie silence. Somewhere off in the distance we hear the unearthly SOUND only this time, it's closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, let's just get this over with. Even Drew seems to have awakened from the haze he had fal He gently sets Zowie's body on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this doesn't work... don't ever tell anyone I did this, okay? You gotta promise... Geoff nods and hands over the digging tools. Drew swings pickaxe, sinking it into the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to bury your own. That's the way the Indians did it. It's like a rule... Backing away from the burial ground, Geoff takes a seat o at the border of the forest. From there, he watches. Drew alternates the pickaxe and shovel as he clears a hol rocky ground. WE MOVE IN ON GEOFF, who's looking on with skeptical intr the rhythmic SOUND of the tools continues.

dialogues.speaker: LATER -
dialogues.text: A cairn is complete: a conical pile of rocks over Zowie's Drew is now sitting on the rock next to Geoff. Together, stare at the cairn as if Zowie might climb from beneath a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he really does come back? Geoff shrugs, pondering such a thought. Geoff digs into his pocket and produces a pack of gum, of one to Drew. With only a quick glance away from the grave snatches a piece and he stuffs it into his mouth. Geoff d same. They sit together in silence. Nervously chewing their gum Watching the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never had anyone die before... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but I guess you get over it. I mean, eventually...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never get over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun dips over the horizon, giving way to dusk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff's eyes shift from the grave to the darkening sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting pretty late. We better go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... They rise, leaving the burial ground. En route, Drew paus last look at the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long, Zowie... Geoff follows, glancing back at the burial ground. It loo magical in the twilight, not quite so sinister now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew is walking home along the road, alone. Headlights blind him as a car approaches. It slows and pu turn, stopping at Drew's side. It's Gus' squad car. He pu the passenger door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in. Drew takes a step back, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your momma's worried sick over you. You take off in the middle of the night, you don't show up for school. What're you trying to prove?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not trying to prove anything. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was burying my dog. Gus turns his eyes away, focusing on the dark road ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life is full of lessons. No one's above it. Not you. Not me... Now get in the car. After a moment, Drew approaches the car. Without another drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quiet now. And out of the silence comes the JINGLING Zowie's dog tags. Zowie's LONG SHADOW creeps over the cag distorted to monstrous proportion by the flickering light We move past the cages to the back porch... We see ZOWIE'S PAW scratching at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda wakens with a start. She rises, eyes focusing on t bedroom. Gus is sound asleep next to her. Then, from outs faintly hear ZOWIE'S SCRATCHING. Slowly, Amanda rises from bed, pulling on a bathrobe as s for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda appears at the door. She unlatches it, stepping ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zowie? Amanda looks down and SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photos of Drew with Zowie are tacked on the wall above th The one photo of Drew, Amanda and Gus has been altered wi out head of Zowie's pasted on Gus' shoulders. WE FIND Drew below. He's fallen asleep with his Walkman o with his ears covered, the POUNDING at the door jolts him Half asleep, Drew peels off the headphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew, you unlock this door! Right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unlock it, Drew! The anger in his mother's voice brings him off the bed. G POUNDING continues. Drew moves to the door. The inside is secured by a double bolt. Instead of unlocking them, he opens a tiny, customi window which gives him a view of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the door, Drew. Drew unlatches the deadbolts and steps back as Gus bursts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you come off lying like that? "I'm burying my dog." You think a lie like that's never gonna catch up to you? Drew backs into the bed, taking a seat. Amanda comes through the door, and behind her is...

dialogues.speaker: ZOWIE
dialogues.text: This is our first glimpse of the resurrected dog. Fur shi wet, the gaping gunshot wound in his rear. Zowie's head h his eyes GLEAMING RED. The husky is covered with dirt fro toe. Drew's eyes widen in astonishment. Zowie staggers across the room towards Drew, nails clicki floorboards. Drew shrinks back in uncertain horror as the moves closer. Zowie absently throws his arms up onto the bed, across Dr And slowly, perfunctory, his tongue licks Drew's cheek. T action of Zowie displaces Drew's fear. Tears well up in t eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zowie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say your goodbyes. Zowie's going outside. You're grounded, buddy. That's the new law. Drew lifts his hand from stroking Zowie's fur. His palm i with muddy blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never knew an open wound could smell so bad... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, he should have been looked at this morning. I don't know what you were thinking. It's a wonder he's still alive. Drew gazes into the dog's vacant eyes. It truly is a wond

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase enters and stops in the doorway. Geoff sits in front of the television with a pile of vide next to him. He's scanning through Renee's old movies wit remote. The sound has been turned down and the effect is eerie.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: We see RENEE move through a scene. Geoff hits the slo-mo and the image winds down. Renee's face. HER EYES stare ou from the alien universe of the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff... Geoff doesn't respond. He's captivated by Renee. Chase moves into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff! Geoff PAUSES the tape. Renee freezes, the image flickerin slightly. For an instant, we think we see a FLASH OF Rene electrocuted. But it's only an instant. Finally, Geoff tears his eyes away from the screen, resen father's intrusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright? Geoff's face softens. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad... do you think... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you think you and Mom would've gotten back together? Chase draws closer. He takes a seat next to Geoff. The pa son's eyes is almost more than he can stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your Mom and I loved each other, Geoff. Don't ever think that we didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still can't believe she's dead... Chase moves to reach for his son, and suddenly the phone shattering the moment. Chase hesitates, but finally he rises and answers the pho After a moment, he returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember Zowie, Drew's dog? He got hurt again. I'm going over to take a look at him. Geoff's eyes widen. He looks like a ghost walked over his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going with you. Chase nods and exits to get his coat. Geoff looks back at the TV once more. The image paused. Renee staring at us from beyond the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus, Amanda, Drew and Geoff are gathered around Chase's v

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase lays Zowie on his side on an examining table and sh overhead light onto the wound. Geoff is looking in from outside, utterly bewildered by t living, breathing dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it happen? Gus casts a threatening glance in Drew's direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glaring at Gus)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some psycho hunter probably got trigger happy... Chase is too busy preparing a syringe to notice the nonve exchange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to give Zowie a local anaesthetic so I can clean up the wound. I'd like to take him home tonight for observation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you keep him at your place until he gets better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure... Drew tenderly strokes Zowie's mane as Chase administers t injection. Zowie stares up at Geoff with dull, blank eyes Drew reads Geoff's bewilderment and joins him outside the Their words are clear, but whispered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he wasn't dead when we buried him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was dead. You know he was. Geoff returns his stare to Zowie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't tell anyone, Geoff. Ever. Geoff looks into Drew's eyes and nods in understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiger is curled up at the foot of Geoff's bed. Geoff clim careful not to disturb the kitten. As he lays his head ba pillow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep tight, darling. I'll be with you soon. It's a woman's VOICE. A familiar one. Now we hear the rhy CREAK of a rocking chair. And with it comes the voice aga humming a HAUNTING LULLABY. Wide-eyed, Geoff turns his head toward the source... A WOMAN'S NONDESCRIPT FORM is seated in the rocking chair the room. Rocking forward, her face passes into a swath o moonlight... It's Renee. With the rock of the chair, her face recedes the shadows. Her soothing HUM remains. And again, her face passes into the swath of light. And a retreats. Geoff raises his hand, reaching out for her. Renee's hand rises from the shadows, reaching for him. But suddenly, THE ROOM BEGINS TO STRETCH. The rocking chair and the bed seem distanced like polar e mother and son hopelessly separated by forces beyond thei control. LIGHTNING FLASHES in the bedside window. Renee is falling and farther away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!!! Geoff leaps from his bed as the darkness closes in and...

dialogues.speaker: GEOFF
dialogues.text: bolts up from his pillow. Awake now, face wet with perspi It was a nightmare. Except, if it was a nightmare, why do hear... ...the steady CREAK of the rocking chair. Geoff slowly turns his head once again, repeating the act his dreams. In the shadows, the chair is still rocking. As it comes f into the moonlight, we see ZOWIE, curled up asleep on the the chair. Tiger is not on the bed anymore. She's up on top of the b now, wide awake, eyes fixed on the dog. She HISSES. Geoff stares at the rocking chair, petrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase strips off the bandage over Zowie's rear end. The w gooey and open. Geoff reads the concern in Chase's expression. Drew is ri at Geoff's side, looking on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. He's had three days. His immune system should've responded by now... Chase puts on his stethoscope and checks under the dog's for a pulse. He checks a number of places, then shakes hi totally confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't seem to find a pulse... it must be so weak, it's not registering... Geoff and Drew share conspiratorial glances as Chase sets stethoscope aside and extracts a blood sample. Chase labels the capped vial of blood "ZOWIE" and careful it into a packing container. When he closes the lid, we s preaddressed label: UNIVERSITY OF MAINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: School of Veterinary Medicine Lab Samples Enclosed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncomfortable with Chase's investigation, Geoff reaches f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take him back to the kennels, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE KITTENS ARE HISSING, shrinking to the back of their k Zowie stands motionless before their cage, gazing in at t Geoff and Drew are nearby, putting the finishing touches bedding inside a larger boarding kennel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think my Dad'll figure out why he's not getting better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he'd believe it if he did? One of the kittens SPATS fearfully at Zowie. Geoff turns at Zowie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can he not have a heartbeat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it takes a while... Drew lifts Zowie into the kennel. Geoff secures the door, something that clearly must be done from the outside. Zowie immediately begins to pace back and forth inside th He turns towards us and we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SNARLING WEREWOLF rushing at us. Chase jumps back, frightened out of his wits and we reali The werewolf is part of a group of COSTUMED KIDS out tric treating. The kids LAUGH at Chase's reaction and hurry on dragging their candy loot bags behind them. Chase sighs and turns to lock the office door. He's closi the night. He climbs into his Mobile Vet Van. We HOLD ON the new sig back window: "A HALLOWEEN TREAT. FREE KITTENS." Beneath t pencil-sketch of a black arched-back kitten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marjorie and Geoff are at the kitchen table with the remn dinner. Geoff is doing last-minute touches on his costume Marjorie looks over his costume. He's got a hockey mask p back onto the top of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who're you going as, Wayne Gretzky? For effect, Geoff slips the hockey mask down over his fac answering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going as Jason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason? Who's he play for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't. He hacks people up. Geoff checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm late. As Geoff heads for the door, Chase is just coming in for evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Where're you off to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going out, Dad! Geoff ducks out the door. Chase turns to Marjorie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's probably going up to the Pet Sematary. Kids've been going out there on Halloween night for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do they do up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you know... drink beer, tell ghost stories. They try and spook each other out, talking about zombies and things... (she shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no big deal, Chase. I did it when I was young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew is at the bathroom mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold still. Hold still. Amanda puts the finishing touches of color on Drew's lips done an alarmingly good job of turning Drew into THE JOKE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You make sure you're home by ten. If Gus finds out I let you go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be home, Mom. Don't worry. I won't let Gus blow up again... Amanda looks Drew straight in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew, I know Gus isn't your father, but you never even knew your real father. He walked out on the both of us, and you remember that. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus isn't that way. He has it in him to love us both. You just have to give him a chance... Drew nods respectfully. Amanda gives him a kiss. Drawing rubs out the lipmarks she's left on his made-up cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark clouds paint the foreboding sky. A broken pulse of l streaks through the dense haze. Abandoning their bikes next to the path, Drew and Geoff a the archway. The graveyard beyond is deathly silent. They pass beneath the archway, entering the clearing. And now, a soft, chilling VOICE drifts over the graves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff, honey. Mommy's here... Geoff freezes in his tracks, awestruck as...

dialogues.speaker: A WOMAN'S BODY
dialogues.text: swoops down from the darkness above, materializing out of A fluttering negligee. Flowing blonde hair. RENEE'S FACE appears out of the shadows, masked with sadn Geoff swallows the lump in his throat. Renee's form keeps coming. But even as she approaches, he grows less distinguishable. Just a phantom countenance no shadow framed by golden hair, resting atop a veiled body. She's coming so fast that she's upon Geoff in no time. He back, startled out of his wits... THE BODY is upon him now, flailing wildly. Geoff thrashes struggles, screaming bloody murder. Gradually, he realizes the body isn't fighting back. Geof his struggle, lets his scream fall off. Now he hears wild, mischievous LAUGHTER. Drew pulls the body away. It's just a heavy wad of stuffe clothing: A DUMMY dressed in a negligee, capped by a blon It dangles near the end of a slanted wire. Clyde, Stevie, Brad, and a half dozen other costumed KIDS from the nearby cover of bushes, doubled over in laughter Clyde tugs at a piece of twine that's connected to the ba dummy's head and makes spooky sounds. The dummy jumps aro the slanted wire. Clyde drops the dummy and saunters forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this, Junior here practically shit his pants. Clyde drops down, nose to nose with Geoff, who's still re

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you're too chicken to hang out with the rest of the boys. You gonna run home to Daddy now? Geoff brushes himself off and rises to his feet. He stare Clyde's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off. Geoff pushes past Clyde and moves on into the graveyard, managing to keep his dignity intact. Drew follows, then the rest of the boys, leaving Clyde st after them, standing alone with the dummy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus' squad car slows to a stop outside. Gus swings open t and ambles toward the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda draws back from the window, mortified. She nervous crosses to the refrigerator and grabs a beer, turning as enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're home early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. Just ran out of smokes. Gus opens a kitchen drawer and fishes for a pack of cigar fires one up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the boy? Amanda squirms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... in his room... Gus tightens his brow, casting a suspicious eye. A sickened look flushes through Amanda as Gus pulls his e from her and marches upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: His feet POUND down the hallway. Silence for an instant. powerful swing of Drew's door. Followed by Gus' hastened down the hallway. And as he hustles down the stairs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn it, Amanda! You want me to be a father to the boy, and as soon as I lay down the law, you let him break it! Gus stops before Amanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? One step away from terror, Amanda shakes her head. Gus lo patience. He rips the can of beer from her grip and sends flying across the room.

dialogues.speaker: WHERE IS YOUR SON
dialogues.text: Amanda sighs in quiet defeat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pet Sematary. Gus turns away and heads out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wheels spin as Gus' squad car streaks off into the night. cherry top glows to life, bombarding the countryside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By now, nearly TWO DOZEN COSTUMED KIDS have gathered at t Sematary. In the midst of the graves, a small story-telli campfire burns. A number of the boys sip beer, trying to that the bitter after-taste doesn't bother them. Clyde sits up front. At fourteen, he's the elder statesme group. With a beer in one hand, and a cigarette in the ot Clyde is just finishing up a spooky yarn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...yeah, that old Louis was one sick fuck... digging up little Gage like so, maggots pouring out of that kid's eyes... Clyde whistles. He drags on his cigarette and puffs out a ring. Sees he still has an audience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie was the only Creed that lived. Then one night a few months later, Ellie freaks out, and she hacks up her grandparents with an axe! (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police found her licking their brains off the blade... They locked her up in a psycho ward and all she said were two words: 'Pet Sematary. Pet Sematary.' Clyde stares at the wide-eyed kids. He grins, takes a swi beer, and moves in for the kicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah! Almost forgot! Here's the best part. Two nights ago she escapes. Word is, she was heading for Maine. Man I hope she doesn't show up out here. (feigning concern)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, we wouldn't even notice her, not if she's wearing a costume. She could be one of us... Clyde casts a suspicious eye on the group. The kids uneas at each other, making sure they know who's behind each an costume. Suddenly Clyde drops his jaw in exaggerated horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my Goddd!!! Clyde lifts a trembling finger, pointing beyond the group spellbound listeners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... It's... The kids are afraid to turn around, assuming Clyde's rigg some unspeakable terror... And for an instant, a look of real horror washes over Cly face...

dialogues.speaker: A FIGURE
dialogues.text: Is coming up the path beneath the archway, rising out of swirling mist. A frightening silhouette, backlit by the m But then Clyde realizes who it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! It's Drew's Dad. It's fuckin' Gus! Drew and the others quickly turn around, realizing it's n of the punch-line scare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids quickly scramble for hiding places in the border brush, dropping their beer cans as fast as they can. As Drew leaps to his feet, he upsets the fire, knocking o logs. A FLAMING EMBER rolls to the base of one of the bri crosses. Drew and Geoff run for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus moves quickly up the meandering path, sending the bli beam of his flashlight over the graves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You boys better not be drinking!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the thick woods, Drew is flanked by Geoff and Cly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man, he's gonna kick my ass... Drew starts to take off. Clyde trips him on his first str hits the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for fucking up our Halloween, dumbshit! Clyde recedes into the woods as Gus approaches the campfi scans the area with his flashlight, illuminating the vari cans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew, you get your ass out here! Front and center! Geoff pulls Drew to his feet. Gus passes the flashlight over the woods. Kids duck away, retreating from their hiding places... The flashlight sweeps toward Drew. Drew freezes, spotlighted by Gus' beam. A burst of LIGHTN floods Drew's horrified face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out here, Joker. Geoff remains frozen in the woods nearby, out of Gus' lig Behind Gus, the wooden cross is completely on fire now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You out here making a fool of me? Drew shakes his head in instant denial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm warning you, buddy! You don't play by the rules, I'm gonna shadow your ass for eternity! Drew makes a break from his spot in the woods. He weaves the markers, arcing around the outer perimeter to avoid G ...but Gus is quicker. He zigzags through the crosses and headstones to intercept Drew. Gus gets a handful of Drew's collar and yanks him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little shit! Gus draws his free arm back and smacks Drew across the fa goes down.

dialogues.speaker: GEOFF
dialogues.text: is looking on from the woods, horrified. Torn...

dialogues.speaker: DREW
