dialogues.text: cowers on the ground, trying to scramble away. Geoff bolts out into the firelight, staring defiantly at silent accusation. Gus is beyond furious. LIGHTNING flashes again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get out of here, Geoff Matthews! This is between me and my boy! Geoff doesn't move. Gus starts to advance forward... ...but the GROWL emanating from the woods gives him pause Everyone turns... A RUSTLING is heard in the bushes, and Zowie emerges into building firelight, flashing his fangs at Gus. His eyes G Gus freezes, studying Zowie. Zowie inches forward, poised for the attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call off your dog, Drew. Drew shifts his eyes from Zowie to Gus, too terrified to a command. Zowie brushes past Drew and Geoff, moving in on Gus. Gus' eyes shift to burning cross at his side. With a swif he kicks over the cross and presses it into his grip. Swinging the cross like a primitive weapon, Gus connects side of Zowie's head. Zowie spins a full circle from the impact. But he lands o fours. Unphased. Taking the next step toward Gus. There's something clearly not of this world in Zowie's vicious st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew, call him off! All Drew can manage is a faint appeal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zowie... Zowie goes for Gus, launching into the air...

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: ...and sinking his glistening fangs into Gus' neck. AN ERUPTION OF BLOOD showers the closest headstone. Gus comes helplessly tumbling down with the weight of the SCREAMS are suddenly cut short as Zowie rips out his thro arms flail weakly at his sides, then grow still. Drew and Geoff stare at the scene, wide-eyed with shock. Zowie looks up from Gus' neck with dripping, red fangs. F moment, his eyes settle on Drew. Then Zowie bolts off,  disappearing into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God. Oh, God... Drew's eyes shift to Geoff, whose face is flushed with si fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he dead? In dazed shock, Drew moves in for a closer look at the bo Gus' eyes are wide open. Blood is still pumping in rhythm jugular with each weakening beat of his heart. It's a gru image against the roaring fire. Drew kneels at Gus' side. He wants to touch him. To shake awake, but with every attempt, he draws his hand back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he breathing? Can you hear him breathing? Drew leans forward, turning his ear toward Gus' gaping mo as he inches closer...

dialogues.speaker: GUS' FINGERS TWITCH
dialogues.text: His hand jerks up and closes around Drew's neck. Gus star him with his crazed menace. Drew SCREAMS. His fingers claw at Gus' hand, desperate to loose... ...but then, Gus' hand relaxes as his last, dying ounce o strength fades away. Drew shrinks back, crouching over the lifeless body as th firelight dances over it. He turns his tear-filled gaze t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man, Geoff... we killed him... we killed him... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're we gonna do? Geoff draws closer and looks down into the dead man's fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could bring him back. Drew's eyes widen at the suggestion. And now, GAZING DOWN on Gus' body, and on the boys, WE PU INTO A SLOW SPIRAL... We move ever higher, until we are LOOKING DOWN UPON THE E SEMATARY. At the SOUND of a shovel cutting into rocky soi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three quick shots: A SHOVEL sinking into the earth. GUS falling head down into the grave, landing with a heav SOIL covering Gus' lifeless face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda is pacing back and forth on the porch, checking he every few steps. She sighs with relief as... Drew appears from the darkness of the woods. Drew dismounts his bike and carries it up the front porch strangely silent. His clothes and face are caked with dir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Drew, do you know what time it is? Did Gus ever find you? Drew moves on past her into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew? Drew, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying not to lose it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happened, Mom. We just ditched Gus, that's all... Drew pauses and stares out into the unknown darkness of t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase is in the study, perusing some files. He looks into hallway as Geoff arrives home, then glances at the clock. late. Very late. Chase rises. He's both angry and relieved. Right now, tho anger's winning out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you drinking? Geoff absently shakes his head. He slumps back against th drained from the night's horrors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew's Mom called hours ago, the rest of the kids were back by ten. Where the hell were you boys? Geoff shrugs, trying to mask his uneasiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Out." Well that's great, Geoff. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I've been letting you get away with a lot these past few weeks, but I'm not going to stand for crap like this. I don't care if it's Halloween... it's a school night, and if you do this again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really tired, Dad... can I just go to sleep? Chase stops and looks at his son. Geoff's exhaustion is s evident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on... we'll talk about this in the morning. Geoff nods and heads for the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CLOCK is creeping up on 2AM... THUNDER rumbles outside in the distance and rain starts t the window panes. Geoff's eyelids fall beneath unbearable weight and he nod sleep. Tiger is sprawled out on the blanket against his c Slowly, we move back towards the window... In a flash of LIGHTNING--

dialogues.speaker: GUS' FACE
dialogues.text: APPEARS OUTSIDE. Washed in the haunting white glow. Strea mud. Caked with blood. Staring in at Geoff. Geoff is jolted awake by the delayed clap of THUNDER and gaze to the window. Before he can focus... ...the pulse of lightning fades away. And with it, Gus' f darkness remains beyond the window pane. Geoff returns his gaze to the bedroom, unaware of Gus' ap He sinks back to his pillow, already hurtling towards sle more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING IN ON the house, WE SINGLE OUT a rain-obscured win the ground floor, the window to Drew's bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew is sound asleep, curled up under the sheets. He clut pillow like a life preserver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew! Drew's eyes flutter open. He turns towards the window. No hears some activity outside. And then Gus' hushed voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew, buddy. I lost my keys. Drew goes saucer-eyed. He swallows the swelling lump in h and rises from his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew steadies his quivering fingers just enough to sink t into the deadbolt on the back door. Drawing the CREAKING open, he gazes out back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scared shitless)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus? Nothing moves outside. The longer Drew watches, the more each shadow becomes. Spooked, Drew steps back inside, qui closing the door. He locks it back up again. When he turns around, he's face to face with GUS. Drew stiffens, backing into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H-how'd you get in? Gus offers a nightmarish grin and raises his hand, dangli keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found 'em. Drew's eyes follow a flow of blood from Gus' neck to the Gus looks down at his dirty, bloody footprints. He's trac all over the linoleum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm makin' a mess of your mother's kitchen floor... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a shower... Gus turns without another word and heads for the stairs. Drew's mouth drops in utter astonishment as he watches Gu clumsily climbing the stairs. After a moment, he returns his attention to the bloody ki floor. Tearing off a wad of paper towels, he wets them an to mop up Gus' tracks.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE MIRROR
dialogues.text: Gazing vacantly at his reflection, Gus covers his ravaged with a gauze strip, wrapping it around the circumference neck again and again and again. Behind him, the shower is running, filling up the bathroo steam. Finishing the dressing off with a sloppy tape job, Gus re the pajamas hanging nearby. He lazily buttons the buttons to notice their alignment is off. He never did bother to He's still covered with mud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus enters from the steamy bathroom. The shower is still Amanda stirs, sleepy eyes focusing on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus, hon. I'm sorry about tonight. You coming to bed? Gus lifts the covers and climbs in. With him comes the ch death. Gus presses up behind her. His hand moves beneath sheets, finding its way over the curve of her waist, care Amanda shivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, you're ice cold... (turning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and you smell! Lord, what did you get yourself into? It's then that Amanda sees the bandage around Gus' neck. seeping through the gauze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, Gus, what happened? Amanda reaches out to touch him, but Gus stops her hand s the bandage. Instead, he leans forward and clutches one o breasts. Amanda tries to twist away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus... stop it! What's wrong with you?! But Gus doesn't stop. He throws himself on top of Amanda, forcing her back onto the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus!!! Amanda's hands beat at Gus' face and back, to no apparent With one arm forced against Amanda's throat, he rips open nightgown with the other. We pull away from Amanda's struggles, back to the bathroo shower running on and on, cloaking the bedroom in steam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff is riding along the highway, his backpack full of s books. Drew is waiting on the shoulder ahead. When Geoff  approaches, Drew hops on his bike, getting up to speed.

dialogues.speaker: WITH THE BOYS
dialogues.text: Geoff keeps glancing at Drew, waiting for him to say some Drew maintains his enigmatic expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well? Drew nods. Geoff's eyes widen in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picture this... Gus comes down to breakfast and he doesn't say a word. He even kind of smiles, like he forgot he hates me. And then you know what he does? He serves me an extra helping of pancakes... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked him if I was still grounded... "no." I asked him if you could spend the night, and he nods. It's like we're a family. A real family. The words have their own meaning for Geoff, who stares to ahead in deep thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's weird...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like he's not Gus anymore. He's different. You know, like Zowie... They share a chuckle that ends in silent uneasiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase enters with a stack of files tucked under his arm. organizes them in the large filing cabinet with the other listens to his messages on the answering machine. The current caller sounds a little annoyed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Doctor Matthews, this is Elliot Rudman at the university. I've looked over the blood specimen you sent us on canine Zowie... Chase abandons the filing and immediately returns the cal it RINGS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock, Knock, Doc. A MOTHER and TWO TODDLERS are standing in the doorway to office, trying not to intrude on his call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We saw your sign. Are there any kitties left? Chase studies them. They look like decent people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your pick. They're in the boarding area. You can go on back. Chase turns away as his phone call is answered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot, it's Chase...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELLIOT RUDMAN has the phone tucked under his chin, in the an autopsy. The WHIRR of the saw drowns out his words as the dome off a dog's skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't get that... The pathologist turns off the saw. His words become audib

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I said next time it might help if you took the blood sample while the animal was still alive... The comment hits Chase out of left field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you expected to find, Matthews. There's nothing wrong with the antigens, nothing to indicate an unusual death...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, there must be some mix-up. He was... the dog is alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this dog. There wasn't enough oxygen in those red cells to pump life into a flea. Chase is baffled, speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You took over for Doctor Yolander?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because the last person that sent me blood from a dead animal was Yolander...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kennels have been cleaned up, but the room retains it dimly lit quality. The DRIP of a faucet reverberates from the far corner. The mother enters with a toddler clinging to each hand. T smiles fade at the unsettling surroundings. Slowly, they the row of kennels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the kitties?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, this is ridiculous... Suddenly, BLOOD-CURDLING SCREAMS pierce the air. Chase dr phone and rushes out of the office...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The toddlers are screaming at the top of their lungs. Mom burying their heads in her dress. Chase bursts in as the mother hastily retreats for the ex horrified eyes flash by Chase. In an instant, she and the are gone. Chase remains alone, moving down the long row of kennels mounting trepidation... Zowie's cage is empty. Chase shifts his troubled gaze to the... DRIP DRIP DRIP... as a PUDDLE OF BLOOD forms on the floor Chase raises his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: THE KITTENS' KENNEL -
dialogues.text: Nothing but bloody ribbons of torn flesh are left of the dangling from the grid gate. DRIPPING. Chase looks away as a new level of fear runs through him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... It's too gruesome even for a man of Chase's background. F the gag reflex, he searches the room for the missing dog. ...and then he spots the broken glass window vent along t And the pile of blood-spattered shards laying on the tile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clyde, Stevie, and Brad are loitering near the front bike Clyde's smoking away. As Geoff and Drew come out of the school, the trio moves intercept them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Just then, Chase's van pulls at the curb, interrupting wh trouble was about to happen. Clyde looks from the van to Geoff, and falls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saved by the bell... Chase hurriedly rolls down the passenger window as Geoff approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I sleep over at Drew's tonight? Chase is preoccupied with other concerns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... that's fine... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Drew, I got the tests back on Zowie. He's not well. Don't ask me how, but he got out this afternoon... Geoff and Drew exchange concerned looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he finds his way home, call me, no matter what the hour, okay? And don't try to approach him. Whatever he's got might be  infectious. Understand? The boys nod their heads. Chase masks his anxiety with a weary smile. With a wave, up, leaving the boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAP of Maine is unfolded on the passenger seat. Chase i car phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have the address for Quentin Yolander? Chase jots an address down on the map. He turns the van u mountain road, winding through the towering pines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A remote, rustic dwelling nestled into the desolate backw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUENTIN YOLANDER rocks back in his thick hide chair. His closed off from daylight by the extensive blinds. He's holding a SMALL POODLE in his lap. Its big brown eye staring back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd be so much more interesting with blue eyes... And now, ONE OF THE POODLE'S EYES POPS OUT. Yolander's fi comes through from beneath the eye socket. On closer examination, WE REALIZE that the dog is not ali all. Yolander has his hand inside the hollowed-out carcas He carefully looks over a container of glass eyes on his selects the right shade of blue. A shot of whiskey rests Yolander reaches up into the poodle's belly and fits the securely into place. There's a KNOCK at the door. Yolander ignores it. Maybe h Another KNOCK. Yolander turns towards the door, annoyed a intrusion. And behind that annoyance, there's a touch of PULLING BACK, we see the rest of the room. Stuffed animal crowded from floor to ceiling. A product of Yolander's ob with TAXIDERMY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm immortalizing a poodle. State your business! Yolander presses some stuffing into the poodle's gut and sew up the stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Yolander. This is Chase Matthews. I've moved into your offices in Ludlow... Yolander's attention remains on the needle as he meticulo stitches the belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I sent a blood sample out for analysis. They tell me I sent them the blood of a dead animal... At this, Yolander breaks his concentration. The needle pr hand. Blood oozes from the puncture, dripping onto the do stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...a dog... Yolander rises from his seat and swings open the door. Chase stands in the doorway, startled. It doesn't take a figure out that the good Doctor is drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glaring)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you bothering me about this? Can't you leave it be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... um... Chase glances to the right and steps back...

dialogues.speaker: A BOBCAT
dialogues.text: is perched nearby, frozen in mid-pounce. It takes a secon Chase to register that the bobcat has been stuffed. Now Chase sees the rest of the room... a whole zoo of stu animals, looking like a rural version of the Bates Motel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (momentarily thrown)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the pathologist... he said that you had reported a similar  incident... with a cat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Creed cat, that's right. Bastard's name was "Church". (grins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess. Your dog's tissue isn't healing, pupils aren't dilating... maybe you can't find a heartbeat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly! I thought it might be some sort of blood condition... immune deficiency or... Quentin Yolander laughs. It's disconcerting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no "blood condition." The dog isn't sick, it's dead. (drawing closer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so was Creed's cat. And so was his wife the night she was killed for the second time... As Yolander moves forward, Chase backs up. He bumps into shelf of stuffed creatures. To his right, A RAVEN sits fr its perch. Chase regards Yolander as being completely ins

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (menacing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want some advice, friend? You get in your car, you pick up your family... and you get the hell out of that town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... uh... thanks... Chase continues to back out of the door. On his way out, into the stuffed raven's perch... ...only this raven isn't stuffed. It spreads its wings an SCREECHES. Chase just about jumps out of his skin, tripping out of t doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus reaches into the cage and grabs a rabbit by the ears. casually snaps the neck. Laying the limp carcass on a stu cutting board, he quickly skins it. Hanging above the cages, there is now a line of furry pel a dozen. Drew and Geoff are on the porch, looking on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we're having rabbit for dinner. Gus hangs the freshly skinned fur to dry and violently sn another hare from the cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dinner from Hell. Geoff splats a helping of mashed po onto his plate, all the while keeping a wary eye on Gus.. Gus is serving himself a chunk of rabbit. It hits the edg plate, teetering on the rim. He passes the dish on. Gus meets Geoff's gaze. For a moment, there's a deadened, look in Gus' eyes. Then slowly, a limp smile creeps over sending a chill up Geoff's spine. Geoff averts Gus' stare. Gus helps himself to potatoes an the plate on. He lets go of it short of reaching Drew. On quick hands save it from hitting the table. Amanda comes to the table with a dish of LIMA BEANS. She a cold, hateful stare and sets the limas down. She's stil over last night. Gus dishes a sloppy scoop and passes it toward Drew. Like he lets it drop too early. This time Drew doesn't save it lima beans shower the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damnit, Gus! This isn't funny! Amanda fetches a dishtowel and kneels to clean up the mes Geoff and Drew exchange quick glances. As Geoff reaches f salt... ...Gus intercepts his wrist. Geoff gulps. Gus drops his jaw, revealing a gooey mass of food. But th smile and the look in his eyes convey dementia rather tha playfulness. Geoff and Drew can't believe their eyes. They laugh uncom There's no other response. Gus LAUGHS too... awkward, terrible laughter. Spitting ou over his shirt and plate as he does so. The boys stop laughing, but Gus just keeps on going. Amanda stares at Gus and carries the mess out of the room Through his laughter, Gus' bandage has slipped down, expo of his ragged wound. The wound glistens, oozing CLOTTED B GOOEY PUS. Drew hesitantly reaches for Gus' neck, readjusting the ba Grossed out, Geoff averts his eyes and sets his fork asid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff and Drew enter. Drew swiftly secures the deadbolts door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that all about? You think he's trying to scare us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know but I'm not taking any chances... Drew opens the chest at the foot of his bed and produces SHOTGUN. A box full of shells spill as he withdraws the g Cracking open the chamber, Drew loads two shells into the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moonlit horizon. Unmoving. Silent. The kind of silence pulls at the darkest recesses of imagination. And now, A LONE FIGURE appears on the horizon. It's Zowie at a deliberate pace.

dialogues.speaker: ATOP A KNOLL
dialogues.text: Zowie takes pause. The TINKLING of his collar tags resume drops over the horizon line, cutting down the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase sits in the den, looking exhausted and disheveled. of him, the t.v. is on. RENEE'S FACE stares out at us. Ch the remote and rises, moving to the back door. He checks the deadbolt, then secures the chain link as a From somewhere outside, we hear a DOG HOWL. Chase's eyes drop to the DOGGY DOOR, a holdover from the owner. Chase bends down and latches the door. Now he pauses at his desk... considers... then pulls some of the bottom drawer. It's a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase moves to the front of the house, securing that door Satisfied, he turns off the light and heads upstairs...

dialogues.speaker: WE STAY AT THE FOOT OF THE STAIRS -
dialogues.text: MOVING INTO DARKNESS, shadow and form begin to take shape a low GROWL and see a flash of RED EYES. It's Zowie. Alre the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming through the door from the downstairs, Chase stops RENEE is on the bed. Clothed in a negligee. Lying across of rose petals. Her eyes meet his with powerful longing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase. I miss you so much...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dry-mouthed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee... Chase approaches. Slowly. Fearful that this is all a drea Renee reaches out her hand. They touch. This is not a dre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God... Chase absently sets his gun on the bedside table as Renee his body to hers. They kiss. Once. Twice. Not a dream. Renee rolls Chase over, forcefully climbing on top. Chase down into the center of the bed as Renee straddles him. Slowly, Renee slips off the top of her negligee...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can come back, Chase... ...and sinks down on top of him, kissing him hungrily. Her nipples graze his chest, then her breasts flatten as grinds her hips against his. Almost instantly, the weight of her grows unbearable. Cha to pull his mouth from hers, to breathe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... Too heavy. There is no pleasure in his words, just unmitigated horro Renee's body comes down on him harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...can't breathe... I can't...

dialogues.speaker: CHASE'S EYES
dialogues.text: pop open, frenzied, AS HE COMES OUT OF HIS DREAM. Chase is alone on the bed, but he's still feeling the wei pressing down on him...

dialogues.speaker: ZOWIE
dialogues.text: is laying on his chest, staring back at him, rearing his a growl... Zowie LUNGES forward, jaws flashing, and Chase twists sid GNASHING TEETH connect with Chase's shoulder, then with t pillows where Chase's head used to be. A BLIZZARD OF DOWN ERUPTS... Chase scrambles out of bed, flailing for the gun on the b table... THE GUN spins out of reach and across the floor... Chase DIVES for the gun and reaches it just as Zowie leap floor. In a panic, Chase FIRES WILD... Zowie abruptly turns and SMASHES through the bedroom wind sending glass flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zowie slides down the room and leaps to the ground below, disappearing into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase looks on in terror. Finally he pulls his eyes away shattered window... ...and catches a glimpse of something in the dresser mirr Something that sends a chill up his spine. The flurry of down feathers is floating to the mattress. intermingling with the feathers are a handful of ROSE PET slowly settling to the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase is bare-chested at the mirror, applying a dressing dog bite on his shoulder. Marjorie appears in the doorway with a basket of laundry. stops short at the sight of Chase standing there in his b Chase catches her reflection in the mirror and is startle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to... I was going to empty the hamper... Chase turns, shaking off the scare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. Marjorie's eyes can't help but fix on the dog bites scatt Chase's chest and arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a little run-in with Zowie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure did... Marjorie sets the laundry aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, let me do that... Marjorie looks over the antiseptics Chase has laid out on sink. Saturating a wad of gauze with hydrogen peroxide, s cleanses the gashes on his arms. There's nothing overtly sexual in her actions, but the ge of her touch doesn't go unnoticed by Chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope he doesn't have rabies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't. I don't know what he has, but I'm hoping to God it's not infectious... Chase stops and looks at Marjorie's reflection in the mir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marjorie... what do you know about the Creed murders? Marjorie stiffens for a moment. Obviously the Creeds are spot for the people in this town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever play that game where you pass a story down a row of people and see how screwed up it gets by the time it's done? People say Louis Creed's son came back from the dead and it drove him crazy... (she rolls her eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed his wife and himself, and that's the end of story. Anything else belongs in the National Enquirer. Marjorie tapes the bandage over Chase's shoulder too tigh Chase's groan snaps her back to the reality at hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Now tell me what that has to do with Zowie? Chase closes his eyes, shutting out the pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase approaches the counter, looking to the ELDERLY LIBR assistance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking for, Hon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have anything on the Creed murders? I can't find the  microfilm from that period... The librarian's smile vanishes. She lowers her voice, foc attention on some paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't keep anything on file from that far back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you've got files from the previous years...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have nothing on the Creed murders, sir. Can I get you something else? Chase looks around and realizes that a dozen hostile eyes him. TOWNSPEOPLE withholding a dark secret. Chase slowly backs away, eager to escape the field of hos stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff and Drew have parked their bikes beneath the bridge sit on the bank of the creek below, watching the water ru Geoff is lost in thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think everyone that came back would be like Gus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... (thinking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...maybe it depends on what you were like before you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finishing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dies? Drew nods. He tosses a stone into the creek, then looks u sun and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go back and do my chores...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go later... Drew shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. Gus'd kill me if I showed up late. The boys reluctantly rise and move to their bikes, walkin the steep grade to the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you at school Monday? Geoff nods. He looks at Drew. The boy is genuinely fright there's nothing either of them can do. They're trapped in roles as kids. Both boys mount their bikes. Drew turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever think about running away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the time. Drew smiles at this. He waves to Geoff and pedals off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya! Geoff waves and heads off in the opposite direction.

dialogues.speaker: WE STAY ON DREW -
dialogues.text: As he moves down the road. Up ahead, we hear the approach of a motorcycle...

dialogues.speaker: CLYDE
dialogues.text: rips by on an old junkyard fixer-up MOTORCYCLE, and he's in Geoff's direction. Seeing him, Drew brakes and pulls his bike into a U-turn, furiously to catch up with Geoff.

dialogues.speaker: ON GEOFF -
dialogues.text: Now Geoff hears the WHINE of Clyde's motorcycle. He glanc back... Clyde's spotted him, REVVING the engine. Geoff pedals like mad, but it's no use. Clyde is closing him, grinning sadistically. Clyde sweeps in next to him, calling out over the ENGINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well look who's here! Clyde veers right, forcing Geoff towards the shoulder of road...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ground ahead drops toward a ravine. Geoff has nowhere but down the slope. Clyde is right there beside him... Laughing, Clyde reaches over and grabs ahold of Geoff's h He jerks it sideways...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops! Geoff's front wheel turns perpendicular. The bike pitches THROWING Geoff into the dirt ahead... Clyde broadies his bike to a stop. With the engine idling off. Before Geoff can get to his feet, Clyde has picked up Geo and planted it upside down in the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess your Dad's not here to save you now, is he? Clyde gets a handful of Geoff's collar and drags him over the bike. With his free hand, Clyde cranks the pedal. The back wheel spins. Faster and faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever seen a tire take off a nose? Through the blur of the spokes, WE SEE Geoff, eyes wideni fearfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither have I. Clyde forces Geoff's face toward the spinning tread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might even kill ya. Wheel might chew right into your brains. You could visit your mom. Geoff tries to get a hold on the frame of the bike for le but his arms don't reach beyond the spinning wheel. Clyde is full of deranged glee, fueled by Geoff's fear. But now, A HAND grabs the wool scarf streaming from the b Clyde's neck and yanks him off of Geoff. Clyde reels, finding... GUS standing there behind him. He looks bad. Real bad. Hi bandages are unwound and his ruined neck is still seeping face is unearthly pale. He's deteriorated considerably si yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Gus! Gus levels a threatening gaze at Geoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home. But Geoff remains frozen. Gus fixes him with a stare that turn flesh to stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said... GO HOME!! Geoff snaps out of it and flips his bike over. He gets a start, making a beeline for the highway without ever look

dialogues.speaker: ON THE KNOLL NEARBY
dialogues.text: Drew stops short of the ravine, watching from afar as Gus toward Clyde.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW -
dialogues.text: Clyde throws up his hands. He's frightened, but he tries up a cocky front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Gus, I was just fucking with him... (nervous laughter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you gonna do? Give me a ticket? I mean, shit, Gus... Clyde grows increasingly wary of Gus' evil stare. Gus ste closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't lay a finger on me... Wrong. Gus lashes out, backhanding Clyde across the face. Clyde falls to the ground, flat on his back, with his nos blood. Terrified. Gus turns around and lifts the idling motorcycle. With on under the back of the seat, and the other working the acc handlebar, Gus advances toward Clyde. Gus kicks the bike into gear and REVS the accelerator. THE REAR WHEEL SPINS. On the pavement it would be moving miles an hour. Clyde can't believe his eyes. Pleading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus... what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just fucking with you... Gus plants his foot against Clyde's chest, pinning him, a the spinning rear wheel TOWARD CLYDE'S NECK. The wheel WH a circular saw. Gus lowers the wheel. Then jerks it away, flashing a sadi smile. Just when Clyde thinks Gus is backing off, the wheel come again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wailing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, man! Stop it!!! Gus gets into the rhythm as he lowers and retracts the sp wheel at the terrified bully. But this time, as the wheel comes down... CLYDE'S WOOL SCARF, defying gravity, gets swept up, swall the GEARS. And along with the scarf, here comes Clyde's SCREAMING fa can only imagine the gruesome instant that follows. BLOOD sprays up over Gus' arms and chest. And then we hea sound of CRUNCHING BONES jamming the motorcycle's gears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dead-pan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoops. He bares his teeth in a death's head grin.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE KNOLL
dialogues.text: Drew has witnessed the killing. He's mortified.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW -
dialogues.text: Gus tosses the bloody motorcycle aside, slowly raising hi to where Drew stands. His eyes meet Drew's. Drew hastily jerks his bike around and takes off. Gus starts after him on foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew rushes through the front door, SLAMMING it behind hi throwing the deadbolt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew climbs onto his bed and grabs his shotgun from the g His fingers shake as he flips off the safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man... Just then we hear the CRACKLE of a POLICE P.A. and Gus' a VOICE coming from the yard outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mocking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Police, come out of the house with your hands up! Gus finishes his words with a burst of FEEDBACK and then MANIACAL LAUGHTER. Drew's eyes go wide with terror. He creeps out into the h clutching the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew tries to look out the window. Then we hear a low, gu GROWL. Drew slowly turns... Zowie is standing down the hall, leveling a dead stare. Z takes the first step forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Zowie! It's me! Pleading, Drew slowly retreats down the hallway. Along the way, he backs right into... GUS, grinning from ear to ear. Drew recoils against the wall, swinging up his shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay back! But Gus just keeps on grinning. He takes a step forward.. Drew pulls the trigger... And CLICK! Nothing happens. The chambers are empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget something, Drew buddy? Gus raises his hand. He's holding the shotgun shells. He fall to the floor. Suddenly Gus wrenches the gun from Drew's hands. He swing and... ...Drew SCREAMS and ducks beneath the blow, as the shotgu SMASHES a hole in the wall above his head. Gus flings the aside and LUNGES for Drew... Drew races down the hallway to the back door. He turns th The deadbolt has been locked from the inside. Drew's eyes whip to the keyholder on the wall. All the ke are empty. Here comes the JINGLING of keys in Gus' pockets as he com the hall... Drew dashes away from the back door. Gus' eyes shift from Drew's fleeing form to A BOX OF TOOL service closet.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: Drew jimmies the knob. Again, the deadbolt is locked from inside. Tears are streaming down Drew's face now. FOOTSTEPS approach. Drew spins around... Gus is advancing, WITH A HAMMER tight in his grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crazed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the right to remain silent... WHAM! Gus SMASHES the hammer into the wall to punctuate h Plaster goes flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...while I bash your fucking head in! Drew's eyes dart frantically, looking for a way out. The route of escape is UP THE STAIRS. Down the hallway, Zowie starts running forward. Drew's ca between a rock and a hard place...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the right to a lawyer, but you won't need one... He runs for it. Gus charges to intercept him... Drew gets to the stairs first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...cause you'll be dead! WHAM! Gus brings the hammer down with the claw end leadin sinks into the stair below Drew's feet... Zowie LEAPS past Gus, tearing up the stairs as Gus wrench hammer free...

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS
dialogues.text: Drew makes it to the top of the stairs with Zowie right o heels. Drew DIVES into Amanda and Gus' bedroom as... Zowie springs from the floor. Drew SLAMS the door shut, S Zowie. Zowie collapses to the floor, dazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew throws the latch on the door. Almost immediately, Gu outside, POUNDING at the door with the claw end of the ha Wood splinters fly as the hammer claw sinks through... Drew SCREAMS and goes for one of the dormer windows. It's he can't get it open. From the hallway, Gus violently SMASHES the door again an The door is splintering apart. WE SEE glimpses of Gus thr ragged holes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you understand these rights, Drew buddy?! Drew grabs a chair and HEAVES it through the window...

dialogues.speaker: STUPID
dialogues.text: The bedroom door EXPLODES INWARD and Gus claws his way in room... Wasting no time, Drew climbs through the broken window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew slides down the slant of the roof. He hits the latti takes it to the ground with him. Untangling himself, he gets to his feet... ...and here comes Amanda, ARRIVING HOME. Drew runs for her car, waving his hands, throwing himself path so she'll go no further. She SLAMS on the brakes. Drew pulls open the passenger door and dives inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus killed Clyde, Mom! He's trying to kill me! Just then, the BACK DOOR flies open. Gus steps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew, buddy! Daddy's not done yet! Amanda spots the hammer hanging from his grip. Gus cracks smile and FLINGS THE HAMMER at the car... CRACK! The hammer bounces off the windshield, causing it spiderweb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go Mom! Go!!! That's all the convincing Amanda needs. She puts the car reverse and stomps on the gas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speeding down the highway. Drew and Amanda are mortified. Suddenly, we hear the WAIL of Gus' patrol car coming up f behind. Amanda looks to the rear-view mirror...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaching from the road ahead is a POTATO TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda hips her head back in front of them. The potato tr blaring its HORN. Gus' car swerves out onto the shoulder, speeding up to ma pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom!!! Gus cranks the wheel, jumping back onto the road, forcing car into the path of the oncoming truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE DRIVER stands on the BRAKES.

dialogues.speaker: THE POTATO TRUCK COLLIDES WITH AMANDA'S CAR. HEAD ON.
dialogues.text: Thousands of potatoes explode from the rear of the truck, obscuring our view.

dialogues.speaker: AND SILENCED CRIES.
dialogues.text: Gus' vehicle speeds past. WE HOLD on the mess of twisted Clearly there are no survivors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff enters first. Wearing a dark suit. Looking pale and inside. Chase follows, dressed in black. It's obvious the to a funeral. Without a word, Geoff heads up the stairs. Chase watches feeling utterly helpless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase exits from his bedroom, pulling a sweater over a mo change of clothes. He cocks his head at the SOUNDS of Geo about in the attic above. The door atop the attic stairway is barely ajar. Chase wrinkles his brow, concerned. Turning away, he head downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marjorie is preparing dinner. Across the room, the kitche playing... ON TELEVISION is the evening news. A photo of Drew and Am appears above the NEWSCASTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Friends and neighbors came to pay respects for Drew and Amanda Gilbert, who died in a head-on collision Saturday... Chase enters the kitchen, eyes moving to the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those poor people. I saw Gus this morning... he looked terrible. Chase pulls his eyes away from the broadcast as Marjorie dinner on the table. Chase yells upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff, dinner's ready! (after no reply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not hungry. Chase gives Marjorie an apologetic look and rises from th Meanwhile, the news broadcast continues. A photo of Clyde on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...in other news, the disappearance of a Ludlow youth remains a mystery. Clyde Parker was last seen on Saturday afternoon. His motorcycle was found off Highway 62...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase pushes open the door. A spring coil pulls the CREAK closed behind him. One look at the attic and Chase turns A huge window at the far end of the room allows the moonl reach all corners of the spacious old attic... All of Renee's belongings have been unpacked. The entire been converted into a museum-like room, down to the last  meticulous detail. A room in preparation for Renee's retu Gauzy curtains billow out from some unseen draft. Picture Renee rest everywhere. Awards. Memorabilia... GEOFF is seated before the brightly lit, three-way theatr mirror, casually setting out Renee's make-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff... what are you doing? There's an obsessive dementia in Geoff's gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting things ready for Mom. Chase sighs. Obviously the strain of Drew's funeral has p much for Geoff. He moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom is dead, Geoff. You know that... A creepy smile flickers across Geoff's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't have to be. Chase freezes as a chill runs up his spine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can bring her back. The same way Drew and me brought Zowie back... At this, Chase is positively spooked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff, this is crazy. Zowie didn't die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did. We buried him. (intense)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a place out in the woods... if you bury something there, it comes back alive. Chase stares at his son. This is insane. It must be. Just then, the PHONE RINGS downstairs. Geoff continues to his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We tried it on Zowie first. And then we did it again, when Zowie killed Gus. Drew didn't want Gus to be dead, so we brought him back, too... It's too much for Chase. His mouth is hanging agape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (outside the attic door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Matthews, you've got a call. It's the caretaker at the funeral home. Something about your wife's grave... Chase nods in private acknowledgement. He stares at Geoff backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Geoff. Just... just relax, okay. I'm going to take this call and I'll be right back. Okay? Geoff doesn't respond. Chase pulls open the door and leav

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase is on the phone. The CALLER'S WORDS bring grave con Chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! Christ, I'll be right there... Chase hangs up, stunned. He turns to Marjorie, who's watc with a concerned gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marjorie, I need you to stay late. Geoff is really upset and I have to take care of this. Don't let him leave the house, alright? Chase is out the door before she has a chance to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff is laying on his mother's bed, weeping. Tiger sits foot of the bed. Suddenly she wakens and HISSES. From out of the darkness...

dialogues.speaker: RENEE'S HAND
dialogues.text: ENTERS FRAME, gently touching Geoff's side. And with its so comes her eerie LULLABY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you, Geoff...

dialogues.speaker: GEOFF
dialogues.text: slowly raises his head, bewildered. Renee's hand withdraw the darkness. He reaches out for her, but she's gone. The remains, beckoning from down the attic stairs. The attic door slowly swings open of its own accord. Geoff rises from the bed and follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff looks into the living room as he passes. Marjorie h asleep on the sofa with the TV on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lullaby drifts from beyond the deadfall. The fog roll towards the distant burial ground. As Geoff moves towards deadfall, the fog converges around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lure of Renee's lullaby pulls Geoff deeper into the w hear the unearthly ANIMAL HOWL once more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase's van pulls to a stop behind a maintenance vehicle. Chase is greeted by the limping CARETAKER, who quickly le off across the rolling hillside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...sorry to disturb you, Doctor Matthews, but I thought you'd want to come have a look for yourself. It's the damndest thing...

dialogues.speaker: AT RENEE'S GRAVE -
dialogues.text: Chase stops cold, gazing at the ground before him in disb The grave is a gaping cavity. The casket has been unearth Renee's body is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... (uncomprehending)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus did this?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stuck around after the funeral. Told me he had an order to exhume your wife. I didn't think much of it until I saw him drag the body out of the coffin... (shakes his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He put your wife in his truck and drove off right through Amanda and Drew's headstones... The caretaker points across the hillside... TIRE TRACKS cut through the manicured grass, cutting a pa destruction right through the field of headstones and on the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear, nothing this weird has happened since Louis Creed dug up his boy... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to notify the authorities? Chase doesn't answer, he just storms past the caretaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van is speeding down the dark, open highway. Chase is car phone, frantic, waiting as it RINGS. There's finally answer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Yolander, this is Chase Matthews, we spoke the other day... Yolander cuts him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't leave town, did you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yolander sits in the darkness, a bottle of whiskey and a at his side. His "creatures" are all around him, eyes glo reflected moonlight. His voice is slurred. The voice of s who's already damned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sorry bastard. You stayed. I have nothing more to say to you, Matthews...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, just tell me one thing. Did I treat an animal that had been brought back to life? Did I?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase grips the carphone tightly, his knuckles white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe what you saw, Matthews. The dog was dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God... (mounting horror)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...how is that possible? You have to help me, Doctor Yolander. I don't know what I'm dealing with here! They've dug up my wife...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm retired from my practice, Matthews. It's your practice now, and it's your problem. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God help you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait! Don't hang up! But Yolander does. And now we hear the DIAL TONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Chase flings the carphone down, looking up as... An approaching potato truck ZOOMS by. Blinding headlights BLARING HORN. Chase barely swerves out of the way. Recovering from the scare, Chase reaches over and opens t compartment. He pulls out his gun and sets it on the seat him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff climbs the stone steps, reaching the flattop meas. short, looking over the clearing...

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: is standing in the center of the burial ground. He's HUMM mimicking Renee's feminine tone. Now he stops and slowly regarding Geoff with dead eyes. He's holding a pickaxe an at his side. Gus looks to the ground at his side. Geoff follows his ga

dialogues.speaker: A VISION OF RENEE'S GRAVE APPEARS -
dialogues.text: Headstone. Manicured grass. Thriving flowers. As if it ha uprooted from her resting place at Pleasantville and set right in the middle of the Micmac ground. And now, the vision of Renee's grave fades away. In its p bundle of white: RENEE'S SHROUDED BODY. Gus raises the pickaxe, offering it to Geoff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bury your own, Geoff. Geoff slowly nods and approaches, seduced beyond reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marjorie stirs on the couch, blinking her eyes open at th of a THUD upstairs. Otherwise, the house is dark and sile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marjorie starts up the long, dark flight of stairs to the The thin night-shirt she's wearing does little to protect the sudden cold. She clutches herself, shivering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff? You okay up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marjorie cautiously pushes open the door. Her concern for forgotten as she beholds the Renee Hallow memorabilia. She moves about Renee's unpacked belongings in bewildered reverence. The gauzy curtains billow about Marjorie like ghosts. And glimpses something beyond the curtains...

dialogues.speaker: A FIGURE
dialogues.text: stands in the shadows, wearing the BEADED PEACH DRESS tha Marjorie had admired earlier. For a moment we think it's but as Marjorie draws closer, we see that the dress has b fitted onto a dressmaker's model. Marjorie lays a hand on the fabric, feeling the contours design.

dialogues.speaker: EEXT. GUS' HOUSE
dialogues.text: Chase's headlights sweep across the front of the dark hou Pulling to a stop, Chase opens the van's door...

dialogues.speaker: ZOWIE
dialogues.text: LEAPS out of the darkness, sinking his teeth into Chase's shoulder. Chase is thrown back over the car seat, grappling with th nightmare dog as it tears into him again and again... Chase SCREAMS, reaching back for the gun. He grabs hold o swings it around... FIRES... Zowie is BLOWN backwards, clear out of the car, spraying with BLOOD... Zowie lands outside on his feet, looking stunned. His che ruined mess. Zowie WHIMPERS and drags himself weakly towa front porch. Chase stumbles out of the van, clutching the gun. He's bl profusely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old saw is laying in a pile of sawdust next to a squar that's been cut in the base of the front door. Chase gives it a look as he tries the door. It's unlocked enters, bringing with him an illuminating swath from his  headlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase's headlights stream through the windows, distorting interior. The house looks like it's been through a tornad trail of BLOODY PAW PRINTS leads into the kitchen. The st repulsive. Grimacing, Chase has to keep himself from gagg

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... As Chase moves forward, he catches sight of...

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: standing in a swath of light. At Gus' feet is Zowie, tong lolling out of his mouth. Dead for the second time. Scatt around the dog are various tools. Propped against the wall is the cut out square of wood. I fitted with hinges at the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus, what are you doing?! Gus glances down at the dead dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dead-pan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was building a doggy door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn it Gus, you dug up my wife! What the fuck is going on around here?! Gus brings a cordless electric drill up from his side, po at Chase in a threatening manner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little drilling. A little killing. As Gus moves forward, Chase gets a good look at him for t time. He doesn't look even remotely alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit! Chase levels his gun with a trembling hand. Gus stabs the air with the drill, feeding on Chase's horr Chase pulls the trigger. A bullet pounds Gus' chest. A SP FLESH explodes from his back. Unphased, Gus regains his balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God I hate when that happens... Before Chase can squeeze off the next round, Gus rips the his grip...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a permit for that? Opening the chamber, Gus empties the remaining bullets an the gun aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't think so. Gus fires up the drill. The bit spinZZZZZZ. He DIVES at C knocking him back against the counter. The drill bit SINK CHASE'S ARM... Chase SCREAMS as Gus withdraws it. Now, he presses it int shoulder. Chase is on the verge of blacking out now. The unbearable... Gus withdraws the drill once again, aiming now for Chase'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (maniacal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No brain, no pain, Chase. Think about it... The whirling drill bit is millimeters away from Chase's e clutches Gus' arm, trying to force the drill aside... At the last second, adrenaline kicks in and Chase diverts drill. It SINKS INTO the counter-top nearby... STUCK. Gus ROARS, lashing out, but Chase manages to duck away... Chase catches sight of HIS GUN on the floor. He scrambles scooping it up... BULLETS are rolling across the floor every which way. Cha his palm down on one and desperately fumbles with the cha Gus' hands CLAMP DOWN around Chase's neck. He swings Chas and SLAMS him against the wall, lifting him off his feet. Chase GASPS as the life is literally crushed out of him.. He brings the gun up beneath Gus' chin and jams it into h throat. Gus just keeps on throttling him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just remember, Chase... I had Renee first... and now I'm gonna have her last... BLAM! The top of Gus' head BLOWS off. His BODY is thrown the incredible force, tumbling him to the kitchen floor w HEAVY THUD. Chase sucks in precious air, then his head snaps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase stumbles from the house. It's a wonder he's even co He swings open the van door and throws himself inside, si key into the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marjorie is now seated before Renee's theatrical make-up entranced. She's wearing the beaded peach dress. With the help of Renee's vast array of cosmetics, Marjori turned herself into a stunning beauty. The lipstick isn't quite right. Turning to the countertop magnifying mirror, she carefully touches up her ruby red face fills nearly the entire mirror... ...except for one rim, which reflects the dark, shadowy a behind her. A HUGE EYE joins her reflection in the distorting mirror. nearly jumps out of her skin. She spins around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Geoff! Don't sneak up on me like that! ...but no one is there. THE MAKE-UP MIRROR catches another glimpse. Renee's RED L magnified tenfold. The lips begin to move...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you really think you could be like me? Renee's fist swings in, SMASHING a panel of the mirror... Marjorie raises her hands to protect herself against the glass. And as her hands come down, she finds... Renee standing before her. Her ghostly form silhouetted b moonlight. Curtains billowing around her. We never fully Marjorie's face goes white with fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such a young face... but you've got potential... Renee grabs a fistful of Marjorie's hair, viciously YANKI head back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll do the eyes first. You always start with the eyes... Renee lashes out, SLASHING a mirror shard across the skin Marjorie's right eye. Marjorie SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff awakens at the commotion upstairs. He rocks forward from his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff pauses at the base of the attic stairway, looking u open door. All he hears are the faint SOUNDS of movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marjorie? You know you're not supposed to be in the attic. Geoff starts up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geoff trepidatiously enters. He weaves through the maze o curtains. And then he sees her... Renee is standing in the midst of the attic. She's perfec up. Gorgeous. Just as she was on the day she died. She sm warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came back for you, Geoff. We're going to be together again. Renee raises her outstretched arms to receive him. Throug haze of his tears, Geoff doesn't see the sinister, vacant her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaching the house, Chase SKIDS to a stop across the lawn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chase cautiously enters with the gun in his grasp. The sp swings the CREAKING door shut behind him. From Chase's vantage point, he can't see them yet. He mak way around the stripped dressmaker's model, past an uprig dressing mirror. And then he sees...

dialogues.speaker: MARJORIE

Renee reaches for a lighter and flicks it on. She touches flame to the perfume-soaked floor... FLAMES roar into existence, racing across the floorboards igniting the curtains... We see the flames reflected in Renee's soulless eyes.

Flames are consuming the attic, licking the rafters, igni canopy drapings... devouring everything. SMOKE is rolling the floor... Geoff reaches a far wall. He's trapped in a corner. There nowhere else to go. Behind Geoff is a CIRCUIT BOX. INSULA CABLES run from the box down through the attic floor. Geo turns... And here comes Clyde...
